body.p: Which is different about the extrinsic and intrinsic pathway?

multiple_choice.choice: extrinsic is triggered by specific chemical signals, intrinsic has no specific trigger
extrinsic uses calcium, intrinsic does not
extrinsic has a cascade, intrinsic does not
extrinsic leads to a clot, intrinsic does not

response.feedback: Correct. The extrinsic pathway begins after exposure of tissue factor (TF), an integral membrane glycoprotein. Damaged or ruptured endothelial blood lining activates the intrinsic pathway.
Incorrect. Although the extrinsic pathway does use calcium, the intrinsic pathway also requires calcium ions.
Incorrect. Both the extrinsic and intrinsic pathways have enzyme cascade, although it is slower in the intrinsic pathway.
Incorrect. Extrinsic and intrinsic pathways both lead to clot formation.

part.hint: The extrinsic pathway is also known as the “tissue factor pathway,” and the intrinsic pathway is also known as the “contact activation pathway.”
